page.title: 07Stratton Parish Council
page.content: Eleven Planning Applications to erect or improve houses in Stratton were discussed at the September Parish Council meeting. Improvement of the A37 road between Frampton and Grimstone is due shortly. The annual audit has been heard successfully. A payment by the Parish to Stratton Village Hall for repairs was approved. The footpath from the viaduct to the Dairy has been upgraded to a Bridleway. The stile on the Stratton to Bradford Peverell footpath hs been mended. Bus timetables, fencing of the slurry pit, collection by the Bottle Bank, recording barns for Domesday Survey, repairing of the church noticeboard and fences of Ash Hill council houses, insurance for bus shelters and street lighting discussed
